{{disputed|date=September 2008}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{wiktionary|catchphrase}}
The following is a '''list of political [[catchphrase]]s''', that is, distinctive statements uttered by political figures that have gone on to become well known.
Catchphrases may originate as [[political slogan]]s, as portions of prepared [[speech]]es, or from spontaneous utterances, including [[gaffe]]s. Most catchphrases are in the form of [[sound bite]]s.
==Argentina==
*"¡Seamos libres, que lo demás no importa nada!" ("Let us be free, for the rest doesn't matter!") – Said in a pre-battle speech in 1817 by General [[José de San Martín]] to his troops just before the [[Battle of Chacabuco]] during the [[Crossing of the Andes]]. *"Tomar a todo el país como Dios y el hombre lo han hecho." ("Take the whole country as God and man have made it.") – Spoken by [[Bartolomé Mitre]] after the [[Battle of Pavon]] in 1861, about the need for national unification and federalization of all Argentine provinces. *"Ahora comienza una época de paz y administración." ("Now we begin a period of peace and administration.") – Spoken by then President [[Julio Argentino Roca]] during his inauguration speech in 1880, promising that peace and national organization would be achieved in his presidency after nearly thirty years of civil war and internal conflict. *"Que se rompa, pero que no se doble." ("Let it break, but never bend.") – The last words of [[Leandro Alem]], leader of the [[Unión Cívica Radical]], in his suicide letter, which was written in 1896. The phrase refers to his party's intransigent doctrine. Now commonly used as a slogan for the UCR. *"La única verdad es la realidad." ("The only truth is reality.") – A phrase typically used by President [[Juan Domingo Perón]] when telling his allies to be rational.<ref name="peron">[http://www.pjchaco.org/pagina?id=6628 Frases célebres de Juan Domingo Perón] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426041531/http://www.pjchaco.org/pagina?id=6628 |date=26 April 2012 }}</ref> *"Mejor que decir es hacer, y mejor que prometer es realizar." ("Better than saying is doing, and better than promising is accomplishing.") – Perón, in a speech when he was Secretary of Labour and Welfare.<ref name="peron"/> *"El año 2000 nos encontrará unidos o dominados." ("The year 2000 will find us united or dominated".) – Perón, talking about the need for [[Latin American integration]].<ref>[http://juanfilloy.bib.unrc.edu.ar/completos/corredor/corredef/comi-c/CANDELAR.HTM Unidos o dominados: La visión de la integración latinoamericana en el pensamiento de Juan Domingo Perón en "La Hora de los Pueblos"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426041531/http://juanfilloy.bib.unrc.edu.ar/completos/corredor/corredef/comi-c/CANDELAR.HTM |date=26 April 2012 }}</ref> *"Cuando uno de los nuestros caiga, caerán cinco de los de ellos." ("For each one of ours that falls, five of theirs will fall.") – Spoken by President Juan D. Perón on 31 August 1955, addressing his supporters to take revenge for the [[Bombing of Plaza de Mayo|bombing of Buenos Aires by the military]] on 16 June the same year, which had caused around 300 casualties.<ref>[http://www.elortiba.org/160655.html The Bombing of Plaza de Mayo] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111027005302/http://www.elortiba.org/160655.html |date=27 October 2011 }}</ref> *"Ni vencedores ni vencidos." ("Neither victors nor beaten.") – General [[Eduardo Lonardi]] in September 1955, after [[Revolución Libertadora|overthrowing the government of Juan Perón]], and before being displaced by the [[hard-line]] antiperonists within the new government.<ref>[http://www.encuentro.gov.ar/gallery/2206.pdf "La ‘Libertadora’ y la resistencia peronista"], page 4 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120128183710/http://www.encuentro.gov.ar/gallery/2206.pdf |date=28 January 2012 }}</ref> *"Se acabó la leche de la clemencia." ("The milk of clemency is over.") – Deputy [[Américo Ghioldi]], inciting the [[Pedro Eugenio Aramburu|military dictatorship of Aramburu]] to execute the [[Juan José Valle|leaders]] of a failed uprising, in 1956.<ref>[http://media.hoover.org/sites/default/files/documents/hoover_argentina_guide_eng.pdf 20TH Century Argentina in the Hoover Institution Archives] (page 16).</ref> *"Hay que pasar el invierno." ("We have to endure the winter.")<ref>[http://www.elortiba.org/ayernomas2.html Ayer Nomas] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080415133628/http://www.elortiba.org/ayernomas2.html |date=15 April 2008 }}. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> – Said in 1960 by [[Álvaro Alsogaray]], Minister of Economy in the [[Arturo Frondizi|Frondizi]] government, referring to the hardships required to get through the economic troubles in the country, which was in dire need of oil. *"No renunciaré, no me suicidaré, no me iré del país" ("I will not resign, I will not commit suicide, I will not leave the country.") – Said in 1962 by President [[Arturo Frondizi]] under the threat of a military coup d'état. He initially resisted his ousting but was eventually forced at gunpoint into arrest in the Isla Martín García Prison. *"El comandante en jefe de las fuerzas armadas soy yo." ("The commander in chief of the armed forces is I.") – Said in 1966 by then President [[Arturo Illia]] to [[Juan Carlos Onganía|General Juan Carlos Onganía]] when the latter told the president that the armed forces were starting a coup d'état. *"Sólo la organización vence al tiempo." ("Only organization overcomes time.") – Perón, warning about the need for generational change within his party.<ref name="peron"/> *"Estúpidos imberbes." ("Young idiots.") – Insult infamously used by Juan Perón to refer to the [[Montoneros]] faction of his party while expelling them from Plaza de Mayo. *"Este viejo adversario despide a un amigo." ("This old adversary bids farewell to a friend.") – Said in 1974 by former head of the [[Radical Civic Union|UCR]], [[Ricardo Balbín]] at [[Juan Domingo Perón]]'s funeral. Balbín had been Perón's biggest enemy during his political career, but the phrase symbolizes how, despite their enmity, Balbín was respectful enough to solemnly attend his funeral.<ref>[http://www.elhistoriador.com.ar/biografias/b/balbin.php Biography of Ricardo Balbín] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111128221706/http://www.elhistoriador.com.ar/biografias/b/balbin.php |date=28 November 2011 }}</ref> *"Es una incógnita, es un desaparecido. No tiene entidad, no está. No está ni muerto ni vivo, está desaparecido." ("It's an unknown, it's a [[forced disappearance#Argentina|disappeared]]. It has no entity, it is not there. It is Neither dead or alive, it is disappeared.") – Spoken in 1979 by de facto President [[Jorge Videla]] regarding the people who were sent into forced disappearances during the [[Proceso de Reorganización Nacional]].<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=irtN9yWBj0YC&pg=PA103&dq=%22qu%C3%A9+es+un+desaparecido%22+videla&hl=es&ei=WG7iTrOTFNDmggfenYn3BQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCwQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=%22qu%C3%A9%20es%20un%20desaparecido%22%20videla&f=false La imagen justa: cine argentino y política, 1980–2007] (page 103)</ref> *"El que apuesta al dólar pierde." ("Whoever bets on the dollar loses") – Said in 1981 by then Minister of Economy [[Lorenzo Sigaut]], paradoxically, two days before a large devaluation. Two days after this statement the dollar increased in value by 30% making everyone who had "bet" to the dollar rich. *"Si quieren venir, que vengan. ¡Les presentaremos batalla!" ("If they want to come, let them come. We will offer them a battle!") – Said by de facto President [[Leopoldo Galtieri]] regarding the British during the events that led to the [[Falklands War]]. *"La casa está en orden." ("The house is in order.") – Said by President [[Raúl Alfonsín]] about the [[Casa Rosada]] (The official headquarters of the executive power) after a failed coup d'état by the right-wing [[Carapintadas]] movement. *"Nunca más." ("Never again.") – The closing lines of [[Julio César Strassera]]'s final statement while acting as the prosecutor during the [[Trial of the Juntas]], a civil trial against the military leaders who headed dictatorship during the [[National Reorganization Process]]. *"¡A vos no te va tan mal, gordito!" ("You're not doing so badly, fatty!") – Yelled by [[Raúl Alfonsín]] to a heckling overweight man in the crowd during a speech, who complained about food shortages. An ironic line, since according to Alfonsín, the overweight man did not lack food. *"Síganme, no los voy a defraudar." ("Follow me, I will not let you down.") – Campaign slogan of President [[Carlos Menem]]. In retrospect ironic due to the extreme [[neoliberal]] policies that characterized Menem's presidency, which contradicted the [[populism|populist]] promises of his campaign and the political corruption that characterized his presidency. *"Tenemos que dejar de robar por al menos dos años." ("We should stop [[Embezzlement|embezzling]] for at least two years") – [[Trade-unionist]] [[Luis Barrionuevo]] in an interview in 1991, referring to the then massive amount of political corruption in the country. *"Dicen que soy aburrido." ("They say I'm boring") – a catch phrase of [[Fernando de la Rúa]] during his presidential campaign. *"El país está...bien." ("The country is...fine.") – A phrase said by [[Fernando de la Rúa]] when the 2000 Argentine Crisis started. *"Argentina es un país condenado al éxito." ("Argentina is a country doomed to success") – Phrase recurrently used by [[Eduardo Duhalde]] during his exercise of presidency after the 2001 crisis.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.luventicus.org/articulos/02R001/index.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030611133756/http://luventicus.org/articulos/02R001/index.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=11 June 2003|title=Argentina es un país condenado al éxito.|publisher=|accessdate=12 March 2015}}</ref> *"Mi voto no es positivo, mi voto es en contra." ("My vote is not positive, my vote is against.") – Phrase pronounced by Vice President [[Julio Cobos]] in 2008 in the Senate, when he voted against a farm tax project from his own political force.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/7511111.stm|title=BBC NEWS – Americas – Argentine Senate rejects farm tax|publisher=|accessdate=12 March 2015|date=2008-07-17}}</ref> *"Me quiero ir." ("I want to leave.")<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1576080-la-pregunta-sobre-la-inflacion-que-descoloco-a-hernan-lorenzino.php |title=Archived copy |access-date=29 May 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160118003557/http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1576080-la-pregunta-sobre-la-inflacion-que-descoloco-a-hernan-lorenzino.php |archive-date=18 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> – Phrase spoken by Minister of the Economy [[Hernán Lorenzino]] to suddenly end an interview with Greek journalist Eleni Varvitsioti when she asked a question about the country's inflation that he was unable to answer. *"A todos y a todas." ("Everyone and everyone") – The typical opening, and grammatically incorrect, greeting of [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] during her presidency. Kirchner added "todas" (the feminine form of todos) to be gender inclusive. The [[Real Academia Española]] opposes such usage. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/1453900-la-real-academia-espanola-contra-el-todos-y-todas|title=La Real Academia Española, contra el "todos y todas"|publisher=La Nacion|accessdate=10 July 2018|date=2012-03-05}}</ref> *"Bad Information" – [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] in response to the question of American journalist [[Dexter Filkins]] who asked her why she originally alleged [[Alberto Nisman]] committed suicide.
==Armenia==
*"Struggle...struggle...to the end!", said by [[Levon Ter-Petrosyan]] during the Karabakh movement in 1988.<ref>{{cite news|title="Civil Feast": ANC vows seven-day sit-in at Freedom Square|url=http://www.armenianow.com/news/politics/32092/anc_opposition_sit_in_freedom_square|accessdate=4 October 2012|date=30 September 2011|agency=''ArmeniaNow.com''}}</ref>
==Australia== <!-- Please keep this list in chronological order -->
*"For the first time, we have a nation for a continent, and a continent for a nation." Said by [[Sir Edmund Barton]], first elected Prime Minister of the Commonwealth of Australia, in the 1890s.<ref>[https://www.webcitation.org/5knSSrQ7q?url=http://www.geocities.com/capitolhill/5557/barton.html Geocities.com], Quotations from Barton. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"[[The forgotten people]]." Said in a 1942 speech by [[Robert Menzies]], referring to the middle class, defined as lying between "the rich and powerful: those who control great funds and enterprises, and are as a rule able to protect themselves" and "the mass of unskilled people, almost invariably well-organised, and with their wages and conditions safeguarded by popular law".<ref>[http://www.australianpolitics.com/parties/liberal/1942forgotten-people.shtml AustralianPolitics.com] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080418073043/http://www.australianpolitics.com/parties/liberal/1942forgotten-people.shtml |date=18 April 2008 }}. Retrieved 10 October 2008</ref> *"[[The light on the hill]]." Said in a 1949 speech by [[Ben Chifley]], referring to the objective of the [[Australian Labor Party]]: "not as putting an extra sixpence into somebody's pocket, or making somebody Prime Minister or Premier, but as a movement bringing something better to the people, better standards of living, greater happiness to the mass of the people. We have a great objective – the light on the hill".<ref>[http://www.australianpolitics.com/parties/alp/chifley-light-on-hill.shtml AustralianPolitics.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080608185844/http://australianpolitics.com/parties/alp/chifley-light-on-hill.shtml |date=8 June 2008 }}. Retrieved 10 October 2008</ref> *"[[It's Time (Australian campaign)|It's Time]]." Used in the 1972 election campaign which saw [[Gough Whitlam]] defeat [[William McMahon]] after 23 years of [[Liberal Party of Australia|Liberal]] government. *"Well may we say '[[God Save the Queen]]', because nothing will save the [[Governor-General of Australia|Governor-General]]." Said by dismissed Prime Minister [[Gough Whitlam]] on 11 November 1975 after he had been sacked by Governor-General Sir [[John Kerr (Governor-General)|John Kerr]].<ref>[http://www.theage.com.au/news/general/the-dismissal-a-brief-history/2005/11/10/1131578175136.html The Age]. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Life wasn't meant to be easy." Attributed to [[Malcolm Fraser]], Prime Minister of Australia from November 1975 until March 1983 (but is in fact a quotation from 'Back to Methuselah' by [[George Bernard Shaw]]).<ref>[http://www.australianbiography.gov.au/fraser/interview6.html AustralianBiography.gov.au], transcript of interview with Malcolm Fraser. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"A drover's dog could lead the Labor Party to victory, the way the country is." Said by [[Bill Hayden]] following his resignation as federal Labor leader in February 1983.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article116447838 |title=Statements from Hayden Bowen, Hawke |newspaper=[[The Canberra Times]] |volume=57, |issue=17,295 |location=Australian Capital Territory, Australia |date=4 February 1983 |accessdate=28 January 2018 |page=7 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *"Any boss who sacks a worker for not turning up today is a bum." Said by [[Bob Hawke]] following Australia's win of the America's Cup in [[1983 America's Cup|1983]].<ref>Nickless, Rachel. (29 August 2012). "[http://www.afr.com/p/national/work_space/bosses_urged_to_toughen_up_on_sickies_13XDFzRlfNwXnzulv91tZM Bosses urged to toughen up on sickies]". ''[[The Australian Financial Review]]''. Retrieved 3 February 2013.</ref> *"If this government cannot get the adjustment ... and a sensible economic policy then Australia is basically done for. We will just end up being a third rate economy ... a [[banana republic]]." Said by [[Paul Keating]] in an interview to [[John Laws]] on 14 May 1986.<ref>Kelly, Paul (1992) ''The End of certainty'', p. 196</ref> *"This is the recession that Australia had to have." Said by national Treasurer [[Paul Keating]] in 1990 regarding the [[late 1980s recession]].<ref>[http://primeministers.naa.gov.au/meetpm.asp?pageName=before&pmId=24 Australian Government Prime Minister's Web Site] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080720141316/http://primeministers.naa.gov.au/meetpm.asp?pageName=before&pmId=24 |date=20 July 2008 }}. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref><ref>[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2004/10/20/1097951764535.html?from=moreStories The Age]. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"The answer is, mate, because I want to do you slowly." Said by [[Paul Keating]] to [[John Hewson]] in 1992. *"Please explain." Said by [[Pauline Hanson]], founder of the anti-immigration [[One Nation Party]], on being asked in October 1996 on the television show ''[[60 Minutes (Australian TV program)|60 Minutes]]'' if she was [[Xenophobia|xenophobic]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/2010782.stm BBC News]. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"We will decide who comes to this country and the circumstances in which they come." Said by [[John Howard]] in relation to border protection.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/7.30/content/2001/s403311.htm|title=7.30 Report – 29/10/2001: Baby bonus details hinder Liberals election hard sell|publisher=|accessdate=12 March 2015}}</ref> *"Ease the squeeze" Said by [[Mark Latham]].<ref>[http://australianpolitics.com/news/2004/09/04-09-29_latham.shtml AustralianPolitics.com], unedited campaign video by Mark Latham. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Don't you worry about that" Said by [[Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen]].<ref>[http://www.smh.com.au/news/National/Farewell-Sir-Joh-the-great-divider/2005/04/24/1114281454295.html The Sydney Morning Herald], 24 April 2005. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"I call it feeding the chooks". Said by [[Sir Joh Bjelke-Petersen]]. Referring to Journalists.<ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/news/indepth/featureitems/s1302903.htm ABC Australia], 23 April 2005. Retrieved 26 May 2008 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080611145323/http://www.abc.net.au/news/indepth/featureitems/s1302903.htm |date=11 June 2008 }}</ref> *"Keep the bastards honest" – [[Don Chipp]], leader of the [[Australian Democrats]]. Referring to the Democrat's role in the Senate. *"Working families." Used by [[Kevin Rudd]] during the [[Australian federal election, 2007|2007 election campaign]]. *"Without throwing the fair go out the back door." Used by [[Kevin Rudd]] during the [[Australian federal election, 2007|2007 election campaign]]. *"Fair shake of the sauce bottle" – [[Kevin Rudd]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.illawarramercury.com.au/news/national/national/general/kevin-rudds-fair-shake-of-the-sauce-bottle-criticised/1537073.aspx|title=Kevin Rudd's 'fair shake of the sauce bottle' criticised|author=Fairfax Regional Media|date=9 June 2009|work=Illawarra Mercury|accessdate=12 March 2015}}</ref> *"Moving forward." – [[Julia Gillard]], Prime Minister. *"Yes we will." [[Julia Gillard]] at the [[Australian Labor Party|Labor Party]] election launch for the 2010 Federal election.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2010-08-16/yes-we-will-gillard-tells-labor/945514|title=Yes we will, Gillard tells Labor|work=ABC News|accessdate=12 March 2015|date=2010-08-16}}</ref> *"Stop the boats." [[Tony Abbott]], Prime Minister. Speaking about 'boat people' or asylum seekers. *"Death Cult" Said by [[Tony Abbott]] repeatedly to refer to [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]].<ref>[http://www.theage.com.au/federal-politics/political-news/counterterrorism-adviser-abbotts-is-death-cult-label-is-counterproductive-20150512-ggyl4i The Age], 12 May 2015. Retrieved 20 May 2015</ref> *"I have a feeling it'll be a bit like giving a gorilla a Brazilian – there'll be plenty of hair left." [[David Leyonhjelm]], Senator. Referring to the expectation of softer austerity measures in the [[2015 Australian federal budget]].<ref>[http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2015/05/12/senators-brazilian-views-budget], 12 May 2015</ref>
==Austria==
*"Lernen Sie Geschichte, Herr Reporter!" ("Study History, Mr. Reporter") said by then Chancellor [[Bruno Kreisky]] to TV journalist Ulricht Brunner, who had questioned Kreisky's comparing the actions of political opponents to fascism in the 1930s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://diepresse.com/home/kultur/news/296191/index.do|title=LEGENDÄR: "Lernen Sie Geschichte, Herr Reporter!"|publisher=Die Presse|date=2007-04-06}}</ref> *"Ohne die Partei bin ich nichts" ("Without the Party I am nothing") said by Federal Chancellor [[Fred Sinowatz]] of the then Austrian Socialist Party<ref>[http://derstandard.at/?id=2958532 Der Standard]. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Ich weiß, das klingt alles sehr kompliziert...", usually rendered as "Es ist alles sehr kompliziert..." ("I know, this all sounds complicated...", "Everything is very complicated...") said by Federal Chancellor [[Fred Sinowatz]]; the phrase is used ironically to hide the fact that one is not able to elaborate on a subject or may even be clueless about it.<ref>[http://www.cas.umn.edu/pdf/wp926.pdf Parliamentary Politics in a Multinational Setting: Late Imperial Austria], Lothar Höbelt, Department of History, University of Vienna, 1992. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> *"Es reicht!" ("It's over!") said by the then Vice Chancellor [[Wilhelm Molterer]] of the [[Austrian People's Party]] in 2008 pronouncing the end of the [[grand coalition]] with the [[Social Democratic Party of Austria]].
==Bangladesh==
* "Rashtro Bhasha Bangla Chai" (We want Bangla as state language) – [[Bengali Language Movement]], 1952 * "Joy Bangla" (Victory to Bengal) – [[Sheikh Mujibur Rahman]], Leader of Bangladesh war of independence in 1971 * "[[Vision 2021#Digital Bangladesh|Digital Bangladesh]]" – [[Sheikh Hasina]], Prime Minister of Bangladesh and President of Awami League * "Joodho Oparadhider Bichar Chai" (Want Trial for the war criminals) – War Crimes Trial Movement * "Desh Bachao! Manush Bachao!" (Save the country! Save the people!) – [[Khaleda Zia]], former Prime Minister of Bangladesh and Chairperson of Bangladesh Nationalist Party * "Shadinota Birodhi Shokti" (Anti-liberation forces) – Used to describe the political parties/Pakistan Army and intelligence services/Islamic extremist and militant groups which opposed the independence of Bangladesh in 1971. * "Jago Bangladesh" (Wake Up Bangladesh) – [[Moeen U Ahmed]], former Chief of Army Staff, Bangladesh Army in 2007 *Priyo Bhai O Boner Ra (Dear brothers and sisters) – Widely used by politicians and activists whilst addressing audiences * "Nagorik Shakti" (Citizen Power) – [[Muhammad Yunus]], Nobel Laureate and Managing Director of Grameen Bank in 2007
==Belgium==
'''In Dutch''' *"De grondwet is geen vodje papier." – (The constitution is not some scrap of paper.) – [[Leo Tindemans]] – 1978<ref>[http://www.radio3.be/html/ev_nacht-geschiedenis-2008.html Radio3, Belgium]{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Je moet de problemen alleen oplossen als ze zich stellen" – (You only have to solve problems if they occur) – [[Jean-Luc Dehaene]]<ref>[http://www.sportwereld.be/Article/Detail.aspx?ArticleID=GUI15S880 SportWereld.be]. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Vijf minuten politieke moed" – (Five minutes of political courage) – [[Yves Leterme]]<ref>[http://lvb.net/item/5196 Een uitweg uit de crisis: vijf minuten politieke moed], 24 August 2007. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> *"Sire, geef mij honderd dagen" – (Sire, give me 100 days) – [[Jean-Luc Dehaene]] – 1988<ref>{{cite web |url=http://gva.typepad.com/standpunt/2007/07/sire-geef-hem-h.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-02-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110717122938/http://gva.typepad.com/standpunt/2007/07/sire-geef-hem-h.html |archivedate=17 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }}. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref> *"Wie gelooft die mensen nog?" – (Who still believes those people?) – [[Yves Leterme]]<ref>Dusty Road Records, [http://dustyroadrecords.wordpress.com/2007/12/06/communicatie-als-een-boomerang-wie-gelooft-die-mensen-nog/ Communicatie als een boomerang: Wie gelooft die mensen nog?]. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref>
'''In English''' * "I've seen the future: it's scary and Belgian". [[Stephen Pollard]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.stephenpollard.net/001564.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-02-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090706234442/http://www.stephenpollard.net/001564.html |archivedate=6 July 2009 |df=dmy-all }}. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref>
'''In French''' *"Il n' y a pas de Belges" – (There are no Belgians) – [[Jules Destrée]] – 1912<ref>http://geschiedenis.wazzup.nl/tag/sire-il-n%E2%80%99y-a-pas-des-belges/. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref> *"La Belgique de papa" – (Daddy's Belgium) – [[Gaston Eyskens]] – 1970<ref>http://www.politics.be/persmededelingen/15841/. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref> *"Il y a un parfum de crise" – (It's starting to smell like a crisis) – [[Francis Delpérée]] – 2007
'''Dutch – French''' *"Trop is te veel en te veel is trop" – (Too much is too much) – [[Paul Vanden Boeynants]]<ref>http://www.klara.be/html/ev_nacht-geschiedenis-2008.html. Retrieved 23 February 2010 {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> '''Latin''' *"Quid ..." – (What about ...) – [[Jean-Luc Dehaene]] – 2007<ref>http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=2N1KR68S. Retrieved 23 February 2010</ref>
==Brazil== * "Só morto sairei do Catete"! ("Only dead I'll leave the [[Catete Palace|Catete [Palace]]]!") – said by then-president [[Getúlio Vargas]] when he was being pressed by opposition parties to leave the presidency. This would come true, as Vargas would end his presidency by committing suicide in his palace. * "E se o Pitta não for um bom prefeito, nunca mais vote em mim." ("And if Pitta can't be a good mayor, you should never vote for me again.") – said by [[Paulo Maluf]] in the campaign for the 1996 [[São Paulo]] city elections, where he supported [[Celso Pitta]]. Pitta was later involved in corruption scandals and served time in prison.<ref>[http://www.digestivocultural.com/colunistas/imprimir.asp?codigo=2024 Digestivo], Rafael Fernandes São Paulo, 23 August 2006. Retrieved 26 May 2008</ref> * "Estupra, mas não mata." ("Rape, but don't kill.") – said by [[Paulo Maluf]] during his classes in one of São Paulo's University. * "Relaxa e goza!" ("Relax and enjoy!") – said by [[Marta Suplicy]] at the peak of the [[2006–2007 Brazilian aviation crisis]], taken from an older, longer non-political popular saying, "Se a curra é inevitável, relaxa e goza" ("If the rape is inevitable, relax and enjoy"). The word "goza" comes from the verb "gozar" which, in formal Brazilian Portuguese, means "to enjoy" (in literal sense) or "to make fun of/to mock at" (in another sense); in the case of the aforementioned sentence, it comes from the vulgar Brazilian Portuguese expression "to have an orgasm" (equalling to sexual verb "to cum").<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MQXoJCDow2Q YouTube video] showing the quotation. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> * "Bebo-o porque é líquido. Se fosse sólido, comê-lo-ia." ("I drink it because it's liquid. If it were solid, I would eat it.") – said by [[Jânio Quadros]] when asked by a reporter why he used to drink. Quadros' use of embedded, implicit nouns ("-o" and "-lo-") make the phrase overly formal for modern political speech.<ref>[http://www.observatoriodaimprensa.com.br/artigos.asp?cod=277CIR001 Complexo de vira-lata] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090704103209/http://www.observatoriodaimprensa.com.br/artigos.asp?cod=277CIR001 |date=4 July 2009 }}, Observatório da Imprensa, Carlos Brickmann, 18 May 2004. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> * "Brasil, ame-o ou deixe-o!" ("Brazil, love it or leave it!") – said by [[Brazilian military dictatorship]] president [[Emílio Garrastazu Médici]] in 1970, as the Brazilian Army's motto of armed combat against [[Communist]] ''guerrilla'' fighters, who intended to overthrow the military government. The sentence implied that anyone aligned with any kind of left-wing movements at the time was supposed to leave the country in order to not get arrested or even killed amid the subsequent chaos. * "Meus amigos e minhas amigas! Estou absolutamente convencido de que nunca antes na história deste país..." ("My [male] friends and my [female] friends! I am absolutely convinced that never before in the history of this country...") – said by Lula whenever he praises his own government.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U8BO94cz_tA Youtube videos] of Lula showing the same quotation used in different settings. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> * "Saio da vida para entrar na história." ("I leave life to enter history.") – the very last sentence of [[Getúlio Vargas]]'s [[Carta Testamento]], a letter he wrote to the citizens of Brazil before his (presumed) suicide. * "Jamais iria te estuprar porque você não merece!" ("I would never rape you because you're not worth it!") - said (in a very mockingly tone) by congressman [[Jair Bolsonaro]] to congresswoman Maria do Rosário Nunes in 2003, when she accused him of "promoting sexual violence" against Brazilian women.

==Roman Empire==
* "[[Veni, vidi, vici]]" ("I came, I saw, I conquered"), reportedly written by [[Julius Caesar]] in 47 BC as a comment on his short war with Pharnaces II of Pontus in the city of Zela * "[[Alea iacta est]]" ("The die is cast"), attributed by [[Suetonius]] to Julius Caesar on 10 January 49 BC as he led his army across the River Rubicon in northern Italy * "[[Carthago delenda est|Ceterum censeo Carthaginem esse delendam]]" ("Furthermore, I think Carthage must be destroyed"), Cato the Elder about the city of Carthago, Rome's utmost rival * "[[Civis romanus sum]]" ("I am a Roman citizen"), used in [[Cicero]]'s speeches ''[[In Verrem]]'' during the trial of [[Gaius Verres]]. * "[[Felicior Augusto, melior Traiano]]" ("Be more fortunate than [[Augustus]], better than [[Trajan]]"), it was the formula delivered in the [[Roman Senate]] at the inauguration of [[Roman emperors]]. * "[[Inter arma enim silent leges]]" ("In times of war, the law falls silent"), written by [[Cicero]] in his published oration ''[[Pro Milone]]''.
==Romania==
* "Iarna nu-i ca vara" (Winter's not like summer) [[Traian Băsescu]]'s reply, as [[Minister of Transport (Romania)|Minister of Transport]], when asked about what measures he took after countless streets and villages were blocked by the heavy snow.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110903180904/http://www.all-news.ro/politic/traian-basescu-suparat-sunt-doamne-iar.html?2%3B1902 All-News.ro: politic / Traian Basescu – Suparat sunt Doamne iar]. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> * "Iar pe cei care s-au apucat să-mi numere găinile, îi rog să-mi numere şi ouăle" (I invite those who started to count my hens, to also count my eggs/balls) [[Adrian Năstase]] implied the secondary meaning of testicles, for ''ouă'' ([[Egg (food)|eggs]]) in [[Romanian language|Romanian]], in this cheeky reply as [[Prime Minister of Romania|Prime Minister]], after press inquiries regarding his chicken farm, part of a larger set of corruption accusations.<ref>[http://autori.citatepedia.ro/de.php?a=Adrian+N%E3stase Citate de Adrian Năstase]. Retrieved 26 May 2008.</ref> * "Să trăiţi bine" (May you live well) One of the slogans used by president [[Traian Băsescu]] in the [[Romanian general election, 2004|2004 presidential campaign]]. After he was elected, Romanians' standard of living did not perceivably improve, and his former slogan became probably the most famous example of empty political campaign promises, used both by Mr. Băsescu's political opponents and by disgruntled citizens as a cynical way of expressing critique and discontent towards his presidency.<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/politic/basescu-sa-traiti-bine-nu-a-fost-neaparat-un-angajament-8414463 "May you live well" was not necessarily a promise]. Retrieved 23 November 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.traianbasescusource.com/campania-electorala-pentru-alegerile-prezidentiale-din-2004/ The 2004 presidential campaign] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131202233438/http://www.traianbasescusource.com/campania-electorala-pentru-alegerile-prezidentiale-din-2004/ |date=2 December 2013 }}. Retrieved 23 November 2013.</ref> In 2014, Băsescu mentioned that this electoral slogan was meant as wishing well to the Romanians, not as a promise, and that he was misunderstood,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ziare.com/basescu/presedinte/basescu-eu-am-facut-o-urare-romanilor-sa-traiti-bine-iar-ei-au-inteles-ca-le-am-promis-asta-1276089|title=Basescu: Eu am facut o urare romanilor, 'sa traiti bine', iar ei au inteles ca le-am promis asta|publisher=ziare.com|date=6 January 2014|accessdate=22 February 2016|language=Romanian}}</ref> although this very tagline was used in a 2004 electoral poster along various political promises.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://infopolitic.ro/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/7.jpg|title=2004 electoral poster of Băsescu|publisher=infopolitic.ro|accessdate=22 February 2016|language=Romanian}}</ref> * "Poţi să ai şi succesuri, poţi să ai şi eşecuri" (You may meet successes, you may meet failures) A sentence that uses a wrong plural form for "success", part of a 2008 interview by [[Elena Basescu]], when she was vice-president of the youth wing of [[Democratic Liberal Party (Romania)|Romania's Liberal Democrat Party]]. She is known for failing to use proper [[Romanian language|Romanian]] grammar on several occasions. Her wrong rendering of "successes" became famous as a catchphrase in Romania, similar to [[Internets|"the internets"]] in its humorous portrayal of ignorance.<ref>[http://www.gandul.info/politica/elena-basescu-poti-sa-ai-si-succesuri-video-2436024]. Retrieved 23 November 2013.</ref> * "Mihaela, dragostea mea" (Mihaela, my love) In the Romanian presidential campaign of 2009 both opposing candidates, [[Traian Băsescu]] and [[Mircea Geoană]] claimed victory and delivered winning speeches after the first exit-polls, making for a particularly awkward situation. After the votes from the [[Romanian diaspora]] came in, Traian Băsescu won the elections, turning Mircea Geoană into the loser, his winning speech taking a ridiculous note in retrospect, with the part in which he thanks his wife, Mihaela Geoană, coming off as particularly memorable.<ref>[http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/alegeri_2009/mircea-geoana-impreuna-am-invins-e-si-victoria-lui-crin-antonescu.html Pro TV News: We won together]. Retrieved 23 November 2013.</ref> * "Măi animalule!" sau "De ce strigi, bă, ca animalu'?" ("You animal!" or "Hey you, why do you shout like an animal?") Met in the city of [[Constanţa]] by a group of protesters asking him to resign, 1992 Romanian president [[Ion Iliescu]] famously lost his temper and addressed these words to a journalist from local newspaper "Telegraf" (allegedly Paul Pârvu) and grabbed him by the neck.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ziuaconstanta.ro/stiri/deschidere-editie/paul-parvu-dupa-20-de-ani-amintiri-despre-radu-mazare-si-cine-este-de-fapt-mai-animalule-document-44019-321316.html|title=Paul Pârvu – după 20 de ani: Amintiri despre Radu Mazăre şi cine este de fapt "Măi, animalule! (document)|work=ZIUA de Constanta|accessdate=12 March 2015}}</ref>
==Russia== * "У России есть только два союзника: ее армия и флот" ("Russia has only two allies - its army and navy") - the slogan of [[Alexander III of Russia|Alexander III]]. * "Жить стало лучше, жить стало веселее" ("[[Life has become better | Life has become better, life has become more cheerful]]") - said by [[Joseph Stalin]] in 1935 about the economy. * "Борис, ты не прав" ("Boris, you are wrong") - said in 1988 on a CPSU Congress by one of the Communist party officials to [[Boris Yeltsin]], the future Russian President, after he delivered a speech full of scathing criticism of [[Mikhail Gorbachev]]. * "...Мы будем преследовать террористов везде. В аэропорту – в аэропорту. Значит, Вы уж меня извините, в туалете поймаем, мы и в сортире их замочим, в конце концов." (We will pursue terrorists everywhere. At an airport – okay, at an airport. But, pardon me, if we catch them in a bathroom, then we'll just have to dip them in the crapper [literally; colloquial meaning is "kill them in the toilet"].) [[Vladimir Putin]] at a press conference in [[Astana]] 24 September 1999. * "Хотели как лучше, а получилось как всегда" (Wanted to do good, result: the usual.) Prime Minister of Russia (1992–1998) [[Viktor Chernomyrdin]] at a press conference 6 August 1993 on currency reform.<ref>[[:ru:Хотели как лучше, а получилось как всегда]]</ref> * "Мы будем уничтожать наше ядерное оружие вместе с Америкой." В.С.Черномырдин (We will be destroying our nuclear weapons and America too), [[Viktor Chernomyrdin]], Prime Minister of Russia (1992–1998). He intended to mean "jointly with the Americans", not the potential 'killing two birds with one stone' misinterpretation. * "Она утонула" ("She sank") - the answer Putin gave to [[Larry King]] in 2000 about what happened to the [[Kursk submarine disaster|submarine Kursk]]. * "Ночью наши учёные чуть-чуть изменят гравитационное поле Земли, и твоя страна будет под водой" ("At nightfall, our scientists will slightly tilt the gravitational field of Earth, and your whole country will go underwater" - famously proclaimed by a right-wing politician [[Vladimir Zhirinovsky]] in the midst of an anti-American rant during the [[Iraq War]]. *[[Party of crooks and thieves|Партия жуликов и воров]] ("The party of crooks and thieves") - the words used by anti-corruption campaigner and blogger [[Alexei Navalny]] during 2011 a radio debate to describe the ruling [[United Russia]] party. * "Парламент - не место для дискуссий" ("a parliament is not a place for discussions") - said in 2011 by the State Duma Speaker Boris Gryzlov. * "Денег нет, но вы держитесь!" The phrase became a popular meme and was parodied many times. * "Говорит, дайте мне американо. Это вообще неполиткорректно звучит. Давайте американо переименуем! Русиано." ==Slovenia== * "Nocoj so dovoljene sanje, jutri je nov dan" ("Tonight, dreams are allowed; tomorrow is a new day"). [[Milan Kučan]], proclaiming independence of Slovenia, 26 June 1991.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rtvslo.si/slovenija/simbolicna-polnoletnost-slovenske-drzave/206109 |title=Simbolična polnoletnost slovenske države |trans-title=Symbolic coming-of-age of the Slovene state |date=2009-06-25 |publisher=[[Radiotelevizija Slovenija]] |accessdate=2015-11-06}}</ref> * "Strici iz ozadja" ("The Uncles from Behind the Scenes", equivalent to ''[[éminence grise]]''). A catchphrase launched by media outlets supportive of the [[Slovenian Democratic Party]], now widespread throughout the political spectrum up to the highest level of governance. A [[conspiracy theory]] implying that the elected officials the utterer disagrees with are secretly controlled by anonymous, but influential individuals or networks for own monetary or political gain, to the detriment of honest citizens.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.finance.si/8326664/Kdo-so-strici-iz-ozadja-je-drugorazredno-vpra%C5%A1anje |title=''Kdo so strici iz ozadja?'' je drugorazredno vprašanje |language=sl |trans-title="Who are the Uncles from Behind the Scenes?" is a second-rate question |date=2012-11-12 |last=Hren |first=Rok |work=Finance.si |accessdate=2015-11-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Horvat |first=Marjan |url=http://www.mladina.si/107642/strici-iz-ozadja/ |title=Strici iz ozadja |language=sl |trans-title=The Uncles from Behind the Scenes |date=2011-12-16 |accessdate=2015-11-06}}</ref> * "Udbomafija" ("Udbomafia", a [[portmanteau]] of [[State Security Administration|UDBA]] and [[mafia]]), another conspiracy theory implying that high-ranking officials of various former Yugoslav secret services (usually of Serbian nationality or sympathizing with Serbians) form a criminal organization that works as a state-within-a-state, ruling Slovenia from behind the scenes even after the fall of communism and terrorizing fighters for democracy. The phrase was coined by the architect Edo Ravnikar, son of the famous Slovene architect [[Edvard Ravnikar]] and popularized by his 1995 book ''Udbomafija: Priročnik za razumevanje tranzicije'' (''Udbomafia: A Handbook for Understanding the Transition'') in which he purported to expose this hidden network.<ref>{{cite book |last=Bajuk |first=Tatiana |year=1999 |chapter=Udbomafija and the Rhetoric of Conspiracy |title=Paranoia Within Reason: A Casebook on Conspiracy as Explanation |editor-first=George E. |editor-last=Marcus |publisher=University of Chicago Press |isbn=9780226504575 |pages=269–292}}</ref>

*"Fattigdomen fördrages med jämnmod, då den delas av alla." (Poverty is tolerated with equanimity when it is shared by everyone.) Ernst Wigforss, Social Democratic Minister of Finance, 1928. *"Vår beredskap är god" (Our [state of] readiness is good), said by Prime Minister [[Per Albin Hansson]] on 27 August 1939 on [[Sveriges Radio|national Swedish radio]] about the readiness state of the [[Swedish armed forces]]. In hindsight, Sweden could not have defended itself against a German invasion, partly because Hansson had led a major disarmament campaign since the 1920s. Nowadays, it is used as a derogatory term describing a statement which is obviously false but intended to keep people calmed down. *"Gärna medalj, men först en rejäl pension" (A medal is fine, but proper retirement pay is first priority), slogan for the Social Democrats in the [[Swedish general election, 1958|1958 general election]]. The medal referred to is the [[For Zealous and Devoted Service of the Realm]] which is usually given as a retirement award, military and civil service alike, for more the 30 years of long and faithful government employment. *"Nån jävla ordning får det vara i ett parti" (There must be some damn order in a party), uttered by [[C.-H. Hermansson]], leader of the Communist Party (present-day [[Left Party (Sweden)|Left Party]]) at a party convention 1969. *"Att vara liberal är att vara kluven" (Being liberal is being torn), uttered by [[Gunnar Helén]], leader of the [[Liberal Party (Sweden)|Liberal Party]]. *"Så talar diktaturens kreatur till varann" (This is the way the creatures of dictatorship speak to each other), uttered by Prime Minister [[Olof Palme]] concerning the Czechoslovakian communist regime under [[Gustav Husak]]. *"Ingen statsrådspost är så viktig att jag är villig att dagtinga med min övertygelse" (No cabinet post is important enough for me to compromise with my conviction), uttered in 1978 by [[Thorbjörn Fälldin]], leader of the [[Centre Party (Sweden)|Centre Party]] and Prime Minister 1976-1978 and 1979-1982 *"Nja till EU" (Both yes and no to the EU), catch phrase for the [[Centre Party (Sweden)|Centre Party]] in the mid-1990s *"Vård, skola och omsorg" (Healthcare, schools and care [for children, the elderly and the disabled]) The focus areas for the Social Democrats during the [[Swedish general election, 2002|2002 general election]]. *"Att ställa krav är att bry sig" (Demanding is caring [about people]), catch phrase for the [[Liberal Party (Sweden)|Liberal Party]] during the 2002 general election. *"Alla ska med" (Everyone [in society] must be on board) The Social Democrats' catchphrase during the [[Swedish general election, 2006|2006 general election]]. *"Det måste löna sig att arbeta" (It must pay to work) The core message of [[Alliance for Sweden]]'s labour market policy during and after the 2006 general election. *"Om man är socialdemokrat, då tycker man att det är häftigt att betala skatt. För mig är skatt det finaste uttrycket för vad politik är." (If you're a Social Democrat, you think it's cool to pay taxes. To me, taxes are the most beautiful expression of what politics is about.", said by [[Mona Sahlin]] in an interview on [[Sveriges Television|SVT]], in 1994. I'm going on" [[Harold Wilson]] at the 1969 May Day Rally following political gossip and unattributed reports that his leadership of the Labour Party would be challenged (''[[The Times]]'', 5 May 1969, p. 1) * "[[Winter of Discontent#'Crisis? [[Margaret Thatcher]]<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/october/10/newsid_2541000/2541071.stm |publisher=BBC News | title=1980: Thatcher 'not for turning' | date=10 October 1980 | accessdate=8 May 2010}}</ref> * "[[It's The Sun Wot Won It]]" * "But in which direction was she sailing at the time" [[Tam Dalyell]] (re the sinking of [[ARA General Belgrano|ARA ''General Belgrano'']])<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/3391825.stm |publisher=BBC News | title=Profile: Tam Dalyell | date=13 January 2004 | accessdate=8 May 2010 | first=Nick | last=Assinder}}</ref> * "Tough on crime, tough on the causes of crime" Tony Blair * "Education, education, education", this was how Tony Blair set out his priorities for office after winning a landslide general election in May 1997.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/education/6564933.stm |publisher=BBC News | date=14 May 2007 | accessdate=13 July 2015 }}</ref> * "Britain will not return to the boom and bust of the past." [[José Mujica|José "Pepe" Mujica]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1569462-mujica-sobre-cristina-esta-vieja-es-peor-que-el-tuerto|title=Mujica, sobre Cristina: "Esta vieja es peor que el tuerto "|date=4 April 2013|publisher=}}</ref> talking about [[Cristina Kirchner]] and [[Nestor Kirchner]] during a conference to a colleague not knowing that the microphone was live.

("PDVSA has become red, very red") said by the President of PDVSA (Venezuelan National Petroleum Company) *"[[¿Por qué no te callas?]]" ("Why don't you shut up?") said by [[Juan Carlos I of Spain|King Juan Carlos of Spain]] to [[Hugo Chávez]]. * "Compañeros, lamentablemente por ahora los objetivos que nos planteamos no fueron logrados en la ciudad capital" ( "Folks: unfortunately, for now, the objectives that we had were not fully accomplished in the capital city ([[Caracas]])") said by Hugo Chávez 4 February 1992, after the failure of his coup attempt. *"Por ahora" ("For now") is a Venezuelan political catch phrase that alludes to the declarations made by Hugo Chávez after the failure of the coup attempt he led in 1992. {{about|the animal sexual posture|the human spinal shape and disorders thereof|Lordosis}} [[File:Cats having sex in Israel.jpg|thumb|Lordosis behavior by a female cat during copulation]]
'''Lordosis behavior''', also known as '''mammalian lordosis''' (Greek lordōsis, from ''lordos'' "bent backward"<ref name="American Heritage Dictionary - lordosis">{{cite web|url=https://ahdictionary.com/word/search.html?q=lordosis|publisher=The American Heritage Dictionary|title=lordosis|accessdate=January 3, 2017}}</ref>) or '''presenting''', is the naturally occurring body posture for sexual receptivity to [[Copulation (zoology)|copulation]] present in most mammals including [[rodents]], [[elephants]], and [[felines]]. The primary characteristics of the behavior are a lowering of the forelimbs but with the rear limbs extended and [[hip]]s raised, [[ventral]] arching of the [[Vertebral column|spine]] and a raising, or sideward displacement, of the [[tail]]. During lordosis, the spine curves [[dorsoventral]]ly so that its apex points towards the abdomen.
The lordosis [[Reflex arc|reflex]] is hardwired in the brain, controlled by [[hormone]]s in the [[hypothalamus]],<ref name="flanagan"/> triggered by [[Somatosensory system|touch]] stimuli on [[Flank (anatomy)|flanks]], [[Rump (animal)|rump]], tailbase or [[perineum]],<ref name="pfaff1994"/> and facilitated by vaginal stimulation<ref name="gonzalez2007"/> and by sexual [[pheromone]]s.<ref name="haga2010"/>
==Description== Lordosis is a reflex action that causes many non-primate female mammals to adopt a body position that is often crucial to reproductive behavior. The posture moves the [[pelvic tilt]] in an anterior direction, with the posterior pelvis rising up, the bottom angling backward and the front angling downward. Lordosis aids in copulation as it elevates the hips, thereby facilitating penetration by the [[penis]]. It is commonly seen in female mammals during [[estrus]] (being "in heat"). Lordosis occurs during copulation itself and in some species, like cat, during pre-[[animal sexual behavior|copulatory]] behavior.
==Neurobiology== [[File:Simplified diagram of the neurobiological circuits of female mammals sexual behavior.png|thumb|700px|left|Simplified diagram of the neurobiological circuits modulating lordosis.<ref name="pheromone"/><ref name="moncho2002"/><ref name="pfaff1994"/><ref name="wunsch2014"/>]] {{clear}}
Lordosis [[brain]] circuits are connected with other [[Instinct|innate]] sexual circuits, especially [[Olfactory system|olfactory circuits]] and [[reward system]].
In female, the main neurobiological processes of reproductive behaviour are: # Odors, especially [[pheromone]]s, make it possible to exchange sexual signals between potential partners.<ref name="keller2009">{{cite journal | author = Keller M., Bakker J. | year = 2009 | title = Pheromonal communication in higher vertebrates and its implication on reproductive function. Editorial | url = | journal = Behavioural Brain Research | volume = 200 | issue = 2| pages = 237–238 | doi=10.1016/j.bbr.2009.02.003}}</ref> # Olfactory circuits (red arrows of the above diagram) make it possible to recognize the partner of the opposite sex<ref name="pheromone">{{cite journal | author = Stowers L., Holy T. E., Meister M., Dulac C., Koentges G. | year = 2002 | title = Loss of sex discrimination and male-male aggression in mice deficient for TRP2 | url = http://njc.rockefeller.edu/PDF_BN08/Stowers02.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Science | volume = 295 | issue = 5559| pages = 1493–1500 | doi=10.1126/science.1069259}}</ref><ref name="dulac">{{cite journal | author = Dulac C., Torello A. T. | year = 2003 | title = Molecular detection of pheromone signals in mammals: from genes to behaviour | url = https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/f86c/a5bb9184911b4271e9aaa2b1e5ea02687084.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Nat. Rev. Neurosci. | volume = 4 | issue = 7| pages = 551–562 | doi=10.1038/nrn1140}}</ref> and to trigger [[sexual arousal]],<ref name="moncho2002">{{cite journal | author = Moncho-Bogani J., Lanuza E., Hernandez A., Novejarque A., Martinez-Garcia F. | year = 2002 | title = Attractive properties of sexual pheromones in mice: innate or learned? | url = | journal = Physiology & Behavior | volume = 77 | issue = 1| pages = 167–176 | doi=10.1016/s0031-9384(02)00842-9}}</ref><ref name="yoon">{{cite journal | author = Yoon H., Enquist L. | year = | title = Olfactory inputs to hypothalamic neurons controlling reproduction and fertility | url = http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0092867405008767| journal = Cell | volume = 123 | issue = 4| pages = 669–682 | doi=10.1016/j.cell.2005.08.039}}</ref> which induces [[vaginal lubrication]], [[erection]] and [[copulation]]. # When the male mounts the female, the male's tactile stimuli on female's rump trigger the lordosis [[Reflex arc|reflex]].<ref name="Kow2007">{{cite journal | author = Kow L.M., Florea C., Schwanzel-Fukuda M., Devidze N., Kami K.H., Lee A., Zhou J., Maclaughlin D., Donahoe P., Pfaff D. | year = 2007 | title = Development of a sexually differentiated behavior [lordosis] and its underlying CNS arousal functions | url = | journal = Curr. Top. Dev. Biol. | volume = 79 | issue = | pages = 37–59 }}</ref><ref name="pfaff1994">Pfaff D. W. , Schwartz-Giblin S., Maccarthy M. M., Kow L-M (1994). "Cellular and molecular mechanisms of female reproductive behaviors", in Knobil E., Neill J. D. ''The physiology of reproduction'', Raven Press, 2nd edition.</ref> # The lordosis circuits (orange arrows) cause the ventral arching of the female's [[Vertebral column|spine]], leading to elevation of the hips and presentation of the [[vagina]] to the male, facilitating penetration by the [[penis]].<ref name="Kow2007"/><ref name="pfaff1994"/> {{anchor|Pelvic thrusting}} # The tactile contact between the penis and the female's genital area triggers the reflex movements of the male's ([[pelvic thrust]]s), followed by [[Sexual penetration|intromission]]. After intromission, thrusting movements of the penis in the vagina trigger [[ejaculation]].<ref name="allard">{{cite journal | author = Allard J., Truitt W. A., Mckenna K. E., Coolen L. M. | year = 2005 | title = Spinal cord control of ejaculation | url = | journal = World J. Urol. | volume = 23 | issue = 2| pages = 119–126 | doi=10.1007/s00345-004-0494-9}}</ref><ref name="coolen">{{cite journal | author = Coolen L. M. | year = 2005 | title = Neural control of ejaculation | url = | journal = J Comp Neurol | volume = 493 | issue = 1| pages = 39–45 | doi=10.1002/cne.20784}}</ref> # Tactile stimulation of the [[clitoris]] (and the penis for the male) during copulation are transmitted to the brain (blue arrows).<ref name="matsumoto2012">{{cite journal | author = Matsumoto J., Urakawa S., Hori E., de Araujo M.F., Sakuma Y., Ono T., Nishijo H. | year = 2012 | title = Neuronal responses in the nucleus accumbens shell during sexual behavior in male rats | url = http://www.jneurosci.org/content/32/5/1672.full.pdf+html | journal = The Journal of Neuroscience | volume = 32 | issue = 5| pages = 1672–1686 | doi=10.1523/jneurosci.5140-11.2012}}</ref> # Activation of the [[reward system]] induces learning which optimize copulation, particularly by the development of [[sexual motivation]].<ref name="cibrian2010">{{cite journal | author = Cibrian-Llanderal T., Tecamachaltzi-Silvaran M., Triana-Del R.R., Pfaus J.G., Manzo J., Coria-Avila G.A. | year = 2010 | title = Clitoral stimulation modulates appetitive sexual behavior and facilitates reproduction in rats | url = http://humanbehaviors.free.fr/References%20-%20Articles/Clitoral%20stimulation%20modulates%20appetitive%20sexual%20behavior%20and%20facilitates%20reproduction%20in%20rats.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Physiology & Behavior | volume = 100 | issue = 2| pages = 148–153 | doi=10.1016/j.physbeh.2010.02.015}}</ref> Moreover, olfactive, auditive and visual signals perceived during the copulation may by [[Classical conditioning|conditioning]] become sexual signals,<ref name="pfaus2012">{{cite journal | author = Pfaus J.G., Kippin T.E., Coria-Avila G.A., Gelez H., Afonso V.M., Ismail N., Parada M. | year = 2012 | title = Who, what, where, when (and maybe even why)? How the experience of sexual reward connects sexual desire, preference, and performance | url = https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Mayte_Parada/publication/221688926_Who_What_Where_When_(and_Maybe_Even_Why)_How_the_Experience_of_Sexual_Reward_Connects_Sexual_Desire_Preference_and_Performance/links/0deec51f9121057cf6000000.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Archives of Sexual Behavior | volume = 41 | issue = 1| pages = 31–62 }}</ref> which optimizes the innate pheromonal signals.<ref name="moncho2002"/>
There is thus, in the innate neurobiological organization of the organism, a true heterosexual reproductive behavior in non-primate mammals.<ref name="agmo">Agmo A. (2007) [http://www.elsevier.com/wps/find/bookdescription.cws_home/712200/description#description ''Functional and dysfunctional sexual behavior'']</ref><ref name="wunsch2014">{{fr}} Wunsch S. (2014) [http://humanbehaviors.free.fr/origine_sexualite_humaine-extraits-2014_wunsch.pdf ''To understand the origins of human sexuality. Neurosciences, ethology, anthropology''.] ''Comprendre les origines de la sexualité humaine. Neurosciences, éthologie, anthropologie''. L'Esprit du Temps.</ref>
[[File:Simplified diagram of the neurobiological circuits of the lordosis sexual reflex.png|thumb|700px|left|Simplified diagram of the neurobiological circuits of the lordosis reflex in female mammals.<ref name="pfaff1994"/><ref name="wunsch2014"/><ref name="Kow2007"/> Lordosis is hardwired in the spinal cord and receives modulatory afferents from the forebrain. a) Median preoptic nucleus; b) Anterior hypothalamic nucleus; c) Ventromedial hypothalamic nucleus; d) Midbrain reticular formation; e) Vestibulo-spinal tract; f) Reticulo-spinal tract; g) Dorsal roots L1, L2, L5, L6 and S1.]] {{clear}}
[[File:DEUX CHATS AMOUREUX.JPG|thumb|220px|right|Lordosis is particularly marked among [[Felinae|felines]].]] [[File:Mating Lion, Etosha National Park, Namibia.jpg|thumb|right|220px|Lordosis in lions]] More precisely, the lordosis sexual [[Reflex arc|reflex]] is mainly hardwired in the spinal cord, at the level of the lumbar and sacral [[Vertebra (anatomy)|vertebrae]] (L1, L2, L5, L6 and S1).<ref name="pfaff1994"/> In the brain, several regions modulate the lordosis reflex. The [[vestibular nuclei]] and the [[cerebellum]], via the vestibular tract, send information which makes it possible to coordinate the lordosis reflex with [[Equilibrioception|postural balance]]. More importantly, the ventromedial [[hypothalamus]] sends projections that inhibit the reflex at the spinal level. For this reason, in general, the lordosis reflex is not functional.<ref name="Kow2007"/> Sex hormones control reproduction and coordinate sexual activity with the physiological state. Schematically, at the [[breeding season]], and when an [[ovum]] is available, hormones (especially [[estrogen]]) simultaneously induce [[ovulation]] and [[estrus]] (heat). Under the action of estrogen in the hypothalamus, the lordosis reflex is uninhibited.<ref name="flanagan">{{cite journal | author = Flanagan-Cato L.M. | year = 2011 | title = Sex differences in the neural circuit that mediates female sexual receptivity | journal = Frontiers in Neuroendocrinology | volume = 32 | issue = 2| pages = 124–136 | pmc=3085563 | pmid=21338620 | doi=10.1016/j.yfrne.2011.02.008}}</ref> The female is ready for copulation and [[fertilization]].
During the copulation, when a male approaches the female, male pheromones (part 1 of the above diagram) are detected by the olfactory circuits (part 2). The pheromonal signals stimulate, among other things, the hypothalamus, which facilitates the lordosis reflex.<ref name="haga2010">{{cite journal | author = Haga S., Hattori T., Sato T., Sato K., Matsuda S., Kobayakawa R., Sakano H., Yoshihara Y., Kikusui T., Touhara K. | year = 2010 | title = The male mouse pheromone ESP1 enhances female sexual receptive behaviour through a specific vomeronasal receptor | url = https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Koji_Sato4/publication/44902518_The_male_mouse_pheromone_ESP1_enhances_female_sexual_receptive_behaviour_through_a_specific_vomeronasal_receptor/links/542a53a70cf29bbc12678065.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Nature | volume = 466 | issue = 7302| pages = 118–122 | doi=10.1038/nature09142}}</ref> Then when the male mounts the female (part 3), tactile stimuli on the flanks, the [[perineum]] and the [[Rump (animal)|rump]] of the female are transmitted via the [[sensory nerve]]s in the [[spinal cord]]. In the spinal cord and lower [[brainstem]], they are integrated with the information coming from the brain, and then, in general, a [[Action potential|nerve impulse]] is transmitted to the [[muscle]]s via the [[motor nerve]]s. The contraction of the longissimus and transverso-spinalis muscles causes the ventral arching of the vertebral column (part 4).<ref name="pfaff1994"/> The lordosis position which results from it makes it possible to present properly the vagina to the male (part 5), facilitating penile intromission. Then, during intromission, tactile and deep sensations from the genital area and [[clitoris]] accentuate the lordosis reflex (part 6).<ref name="gonzalez2007">{{cite journal | author = Gonzalez-Flores O., Beyer C., Lima-Hernandez F.J., Gomora-Arrati P., Gomez-Camarillo M.A., Hoffman K., Etgen A.M. | year = 2007 | title = Facilitation of estrous behavior by vaginal cervical stimulation in female rats involves alpha1-adrenergic receptor activation of the nitric oxide pathway | journal = Behavioural Brain Research | volume = 176 | issue = 2| pages = 237–243 | pmc=1810388 | pmid=17095102 | doi=10.1016/j.bbr.2006.10.007}}</ref> It is thus observed that the physiological and neurobiological organization of the lordosis behavior reflex is specifically adapted to heterosexual [[Copulation (zoology)|copulation]].
== Hormonal and cerebral regulation of lordosis == Sexual behaviour is optimized for reproduction, and the [[hypothalamus]] is the key brain area which regulates and coordinates the physiological and behavioural aspects of reproduction.<ref name="Plant">Plant T., Zeleznik A. (Eds). ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=I1ACBAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false Knobil and Neill's Physiology of Reproduction]''. Academic Press, 4th edition, 2015</ref> Most of the time, the [[ventromedial nucleus]] of the hypothalamus (VMN) inhibit lordosis. But when environmental conditions are favorable and the female is in estrus, the [[estrogen]] [[hormone]], [[estradiol]], induces [[sexual receptivity]] by the [[neuron]]s in the [[ventromedial nucleus]],<ref name="pmid9638959">{{cite journal |vauthors=Kow LM, Pfaff DW |title=Mapping of neural and signal transduction pathways for lordosis in the search for estrogen actions on the central nervous system |journal=Behav. Brain Res. |volume=92 |issue=2 |pages=169–180 |date=May 1998 |pmid=9638959 |doi=10.1016/S0166-4328(97)00189-7}}</ref> the [[periaqueductal gray]], and other areas of the [[brain]]. The ventromedial hypothalamus sends impulses down [[axon]]s synapsing with neurons in the periaqueductal gray. These convey an impulse to neurons in the medullary [[reticular formation]] which project down the [[reticulospinal tract]] and synapse with the neurobiological circuits of the lordosis reflex in the [[spinal cord]] (L1–L6). These neurobiological processes induced by estradiol enable the tactile stimuli to trigger lordosis.
The mechanisms of regulation of this [[Estrogen-dependent condition|estrogen-dependent]] lordosis reflex have been identified through different types of [[experiment]]s. When the VMN is lesioned lordosis is abolished; this suggests the importance of this cerebral structure in the regulation of lordosis. Concerning hormones, displays of lordosis can be affected by avariectomy, injections of estradiol benzoate and progesterone,<ref>{{cite journal|title=Development of steroid-induced lordosis in female guinea pigs: effects of different estradiol and progesterone treatments, clonidine, and early weaning.|author1=Olster, D.H. |author2=Blaustein, J.D.|journal=Hormones and Behavior |year=1989|volume=23|issue=1|pages=118–129|pmid=2538389|doi=10.1016/0018-506x(89)90079-2}}</ref> or exposure to [[Stress (biology)|stress]] during puberty.<ref name="auto">{{cite journal|author1=Jasmina Kercmar |author2=Stuart Tobet |author3=Gregor Majdic |title=Social Isolation during Puberty Affects Female Sexual Behavior in Mice |journal=Frontiers in Behavioral Neuroscience|year=2014 |doi=10.3389/fnbeh.2014.00337 |pmid=25324747 |volume=8 |pages=337 |pmc=4179611}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|author1=D. Daniels |author2=LM. Flanagan-Cato |title=Social Isolation during Puberty Affects Female Sexual Behavior in Mice |journal=J Neurobiology|year=2000|pmid=10992252|volume=45|pages=1–13}}</ref> Specifically, stress can suppressed the [[Hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis|hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal (HPG) axis]] and therefore decrease concentrations of gonadal hormones. Consequently, these reductions in exposure to gonadal hormones around puberty can result in decreases in sexual behavior in adulthood, including displays of lordosis.<ref name="auto" /> Lordosis can also be elicited by human manual cutaneous stimulation of the flanks followed by the rump-tail base-perineum region;<ref name="Pfaff">{{cite journal|journal=Journal of Physiology |year=1979 |volume=288 |pages=189–202|title=Facilitation of the lordosis reflex of female rats from the ventromedial nucleus of the hypothalamus|author1=Pfaff, D.W. |author2=Sakuma, Y.|url=http://jp.physoc.org/content/288/1/189.full.pdf|issue=1}}</ref> this allows the researcher to evaluate the effects of his experiments with a simple palpation.
== Evolution, from rodent to human == Increased [[Evolution of the brain|corticalization]] of the brain induces several changes in the control of sexual behavior, including lordosis behavior.<ref name="wunsch2017">Wunsch S. [https://www.researchgate.net/publication/312407857_Phylogenesis_of_mammal_sexuality_Analysis_of_the_evolution_of_proximal_factors Phylogenesis of mammal sexuality. Analysis of the evolution of proximal factors]. Sexologies 26(1):e1-e10, 2017</ref> [[File:Evolution of the biological factors of sexual behavior.png|thumb|600px|left|Evolution of the main neurobiological factors that control the sexual behavior of mammals.<ref name="wunsch2017" /><ref name="nei2008">{{cite journal | author = Nei M., Niimura Y., Nozawa M. | year = 2008 | title = The evolution of animal chemosensory receptor gene repertoires: roles of chance and necessity | url = http://www.niimura.sakura.ne.jp/papers/Nei_et_al_2008.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Nat. Rev. Genet. | volume = 9 | issue = 12| pages = 951–963 | doi=10.1038/nrg2480}}</ref><ref name="zhang">{{cite journal | author = Zhang J., Webb D. M. | year = 2003 | title = Evolutionary deterioration of the vomeronasal pheromone transduction pathway in catarrhine primates | url = http://www.pnas.org/content/100/14/8337.full | journal = Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America | volume = 100 | issue = 14| pages = 8337–8341 | doi=10.1073/pnas.1331721100| pmc = 166230 }}</ref>]] {{clear}}
These changes induced an evolution of the stereotyped [[Reflex arc|reflex]] sexual behaviors of non-human mammals to "the astounding variety of human sexual behaviors".<ref name="agmo" /> From the anthropoids onwards ([[simian]]s/monkeys) there is a gradual loss of the lordotic reflex, in parallel with the loss of major hormone effects and [[Estrous cycle|estrus]].<ref name="Dixson">Dixson A.F. ''[https://books.google.com/books?id=khzhd2nXWM0C&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false Primate sexuality: Comparative studies of the Prosimians, Monkeys, Apes, and Human Beings]''. Oxford University Press, 2nd edition, 2012</ref> In the [[Cercopithecidae]] ([[macaque]]s, etc.), the lordotic reflex is still functional, but it is part of sexual and sociosexual activities such as presenting. This sociosexual presenting (which follows the same sequence as lordosis: curvature of the back and lateral movement of the tail, which presents the genital region to view) is no longer dependent on hormonal control, but occurs in response to a social situation.<ref name="Hanby">Hanby J.P. "Sociosexual development in primates." in Bateson P.P. (Ed). ''Perspectives in Ethology'', volume 2. Plenum Press, (1):1–67, 1976</ref> In the [[Hominidae]], lordosis and immobilisation are absent, even during the phase around [[ovulation]]. Female receptiveness is neither obligatory nor passive. The female can actively avoid or refuse the male, or can terminate the encounter.<ref name="Dixson" />
== In humans== As a result of these evolved differences, lordosis behavior becomes secondary in [[hominidae]] and is apparently non functional in humans. There is no human analogue to the lordosis reflex, although lordosis-like positions can be observed in women being mounted from behind.<ref name="Pfaus">Pfaus, J. G.; Flanagan-Cato, L. M.; Blaustein, J. D. "Female sexual behavior". in Plant T., Zeleznik A. (Eds). ''Knobil and Neill's Physiology of Reproduction''. Academic Press, 4th edition, 2015</ref> When a woman gets onto all fours, curves her back and remains still, it is no longer a reflex movement triggered by sexual stimuli, but a voluntary movement.<ref name="wunsch2017"/> In women, the motor reflexes involved in copulation have been replaced by new sexual activities, several of which have nothing to do with [[Copulation (zoology)|copulation]] nor fertilisation. Unlike lordosis, human sexual activities ([[kiss]]ing, mutual [[masturbation]], [[fellatio]], face-to-face coitus, etc.) are not motor [[Reflex arc|reflexes]], but are mostly voluntary and learned activities, in order to obtain sexual [[Reward system|rewards]].<ref name="agmo"/><ref name="wunsch2007">Wunsch, S. (2007). [http://psychobiologie.ouvaton.org/telechargement/these_comportement_reproduction.pdf ''Rôle et importance des processus de renforcement dans l'apprentissage du comportement de reproduction chez l'Homme'']. Ph.D. thesis, [[Sorbonne]], Paris.</ref><ref name="georgiadis2012">{{cite journal | author = Georgiadis J.R., Kringelbach M.L., Pfaus J.G. | year = 2012 | title = Sex for fun: a synthesis of human and animal neurobiology | url = http://www.kringelbach.org/papers/nru_Georgiadis2012.pdf | format = PDF | journal = Nat. Rev. Urol. | volume = 9 | issue = 9| pages = 486–498 | doi=10.1038/nrurol.2012.151}}</ref>
However, in a recent study, using 3D models and eye-tracking technology it is shown the slight thrusting out of a woman's back influence how attractive others perceive her to be and captures the gaze of both men and women.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.springer.com/gp/about-springer/media/research-news/all-english-research-news/why-arched-backs-are-attractive/15163220|title=Why arched backs are attractive |author=Elizabeth Hawkins |date=October 25, 2017 |publisher=springer.com}}</ref> The authors argue "while reflexive lordosis posture is not exhibited by human females and receptivity is not passive or obligatory for them, a manifestation of lumbar curvature might serve as a vestigial remnant of proceptivity-/receptivity-communicative signal between men and women".<ref>{{cite journal |doi=10.1007/s40806-017-0123-7 |title=Arching the Back (Lumbar Curvature) as a Female Sexual Proceptivity Signal: an Eye-Tracking Study |year=2017 |last=Pazhoohi |first=F. |last2=Doyle |first2=J.F. |last3=Macedo |first3=A.F. |last4=Arantes |first4=J. |journal= Evolutionary Psychological Science |pages=1–8}}</ref> Previously, [[anthropologist]] [[Helen Fisher (anthropologist)|Helen Fisher]] also speculated that when a human female wears [[high-heeled footwear]] the buttocks thrust out and the back arches into a pose that simulates lordosis behavior, which is why high heels are considered "sexy".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/32970817/ns/today-today_fashion_and_beauty/|title=Do high heels empower or oppress women? |author=Laura T. Coffey |date=Sep 23, 2009 |publisher=TODAY msnbc.com}}</ref>
